trans-unit.source: Represents the properties of an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref> object.
This class cannot be inherited.

The AutoGeneratedFieldProperties class is used by data-bound controls to specify the properties of an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object when creating an automatically generated field.

For example, when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control creates an automatically generated row, it creates an AutoGeneratedFieldProperties object with the row's properties and passes it to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.CreateAutoGeneratedRow%2A> method.

Likewise, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control passes an AutoGeneratedFieldProperties object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.CreateAutoGeneratedColumn%2A> method when creating an automatically generated column.
> [!NOTE] > This class is typically used only when extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.

You can specify the name of the field to bind to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.DataField%2A> property.
To specify the data type of the field values, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.Type%2A> property.
You can prevent users from modifying the field values by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.IsReadOnly%2A> property to `true`.
You can also assign a name to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.Name%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> class.
> [!NOTE] > This constructor is primarily used by control developers when extending a data-bound control.
Gets or sets the name of the field bound to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref> object.
Use the DataField property to specify the name of the data field to bind to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object automatically displays the values in the appropriate control, based on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties.Type%2A> property.
For example, <xref:System.Boolean> values are displayed in check box controls, while <xref:System.String> values are displayed as plain text.
The name of the field bound to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref>.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the values displayed in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref> object can be modified in edit mode.
Use the IsReadOnly property to specify whether the values of the field bound to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object can be modified in edit mode.
When a data-bound control is in edit mode, fields that are read-only are displayed as plain text, without any editing controls.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the values are read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref> object.
Use the Name property to specify the name of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object.
The name is often the name of the field bound to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object.

The value of this property is also displayed in the header section of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> or a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref> object.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes.
The IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState property is used to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> object is tracking its view-state changes.
> [!NOTE] > This property is used primarily by control developers.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Loads the previously saved view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties"></xref> object.
The IStateManager.LoadViewState method is used to load the previously saved view state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> control.
> [!NOTE] > This method is used primarily by control developers when extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> control.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties"></xref>.
Saves the current view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties"></xref> object.
The IStateManager.SaveViewState method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> class to save the state of the object.
An <xref:System.Object> that contains the saved state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties"></xref> object.
Marks the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving view-state changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties"></xref> object.

This method is overridden to mark the starting point at which to begin tracking and saving changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties> object as part of the object's view state.
Gets or sets the data type of the value displayed in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties"></xref> object.
Use the Type property to specify the data type of the value displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object.
The data type determines what type of control is rendered in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object to display the value.
For example, a check box control is displayed when the type is <xref:System.Boolean>.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the data type of the value displayed in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedFieldProperties"></xref> object.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, which indicates that this property is not set.
